data.title: Off the beaten path
data.text: Off to side sits this small cafe. Clean, appealing design.  Friendly staff.  Miso soup is solid.  Teriyaki chicken was good.  The ramen was not very different than packaged, so this was slightly disappointing.  Inexpensive.  Good for a light, low stress meal.

data.title: MUST look for this but SO worth it!
data.text: In Long Beach for one night and found on Yelp. Delicious! Fresh! Friendly counter service and all priced just right. Home style Japanese/Korean meats on rice bowl with added miso soup and watermelon. Off the main street and slightly behind a Johnny Rockets closed for renovation, but don't let the sketchy setting throw you off. Enjoy!

data.title: Great eats
data.text: You are going to have to go looking for this establishment. Located midway back behind Johnny Rockets. All the rice dishes were yummy we especially liked the octopus. Kind of has a Japanese noodle house feel. Dinner for four without drinks came to roughly $10 each. Diffusion type restaurant where halfway self-service and fast food

data.title: Bowled Over by the Freshness
data.text:
Donburri, abbreviated as "Don" literally means bowl - and this family-owned, small-scaled restaurant serves freshly-made Japanese rice-bowl-dishes. There are about 18 to choose from combining fish, meat, vegetables, and sauces - that are simmered - and served over white rice.

I believe it to be a health-conscious, tasty eatery.
Every item I continually try, is good. Every item is made on the premises. It's truly a "Mom & Pop" business so be excited and tolerant of any wait. Co-owners Steve & Amy, and their extra hands, really do a wonderful job, wait-time, time-after-time, considering they opened in 2015.

Originally, I ventured out, tiring of my old ways - trying new things, foods, and destinations. I chose #10 - Oyako Don, a delicious chicken & egg ( think scramble ) with sauce on-the-side. I wasn't surprised to have learned, I ordered the most generic bowl throughout all of Japan. 

The portion was filling - it is accompanied with a green salad - miso soup (with just the right amount of saltiness). And for a small fee, a side of radish kimchi - or of jalapeños or of cabbage. Overall, the value is outstanding, and the food is fresh, flavorful, and cooked-to-order. 

The culinary skill of combining Japanese/Korean spices and cooking-styles is masterful without being overpowered by sauce. And seeing kitchen and dining areas as beautiful - with clean-gleam wood and stone finishes - heightens a visit here.

Donburi is a welcome new addition for dining in the LBC, for lunch and early dinners - with Sake & Beer available for purchase,  while dining indoors only.

data.title: Fresh and tasty
data.text: Had a really good lunch at this small Japanese place just off Pine. The menu includes a variety of rice bowls. I chose the vegetarian bibimbop and added a side of gyozas. The gyozas were very good, and the bibimbop was very fresh and (with the included sauces) delicious. The accompanying soup and salad were also good. The miso soup was actually outstanding.

data.title: Great fast casual food in Downtown Long Beach!
data.text:
Living in downtown Long Beach has its perks. Lots of different restaurants, but sometimes it can get to be a bit pricey. Luckily, we now have Donburi Cafe!

If you want authentic Japanese/Korean rice bowls that are decently priced and delicious, you must come by! We've tried and loved their:

Katsu Don
Oyako Don
Spicy Chicken Teriyaki Don
Spicy Pork Don
Galbi Don - My fave!! Just a little on the pricier side
Garden Bibimbap
Katsu Curry Don

We often will order more bowls so that we can have it for lunch the next day. The portions are generous (including the protein)! Okay, now that you know just how much we love this place.. try it out!. Their rice bowls come with Miso soup and a side of fruit.. so you won't leave hungry! .. I'm hungry just thinking about their food!!

On a different note, the owners are super adorable and you can tell they put a lot of love and care into their product!

TIP: Ask for a rewards card! If you buy 9 bowls, you get the 10th one free (under $9).. and your name on their wall of fame!!
Delete review

data.title: どんぶり
data.text: 10ドル以下で日本のどんぶりが食べれます。味もグッドです。店内も清潔で、また機会があれば行きたいです。

data.title: 간단하고 신선한 일식식사
data.text:
good taste, fresh food

특히 일본 한국 중국사람에게 미국 여행중 맛 볼 수있는  동양식 식사

매운음식을 좋아하면 특별히 고추장요리를 맛볼 수 있다.
